data.text: Jill Marie JonesJones appeared in the 2007 film The Perfect Holiday, which also stars Queen Latifah and Terrence Howard as well as Morris Chestnut, Rachel True, and Gabrielle Union.Emilie de RavinShe starred as Brendan Frye's heroin-addicted ex-girlfriend Emily in the neo-noir film Brick (2005).Laila MorseIn 2000, Morse played Laila in the hit film Love, Honour and Obey, where she co-starred with Sadie Frost, Jonny Lee Miller, Jude Law, Ray Winstone, Sean Pertwee, Denise Van Outen and Kathy Burke, who had been her co-star in Nil By Mouth.Jason GedrickGedrick also starred in the 2006 movie Hidden Places alongside Sydney Penney and Shirley Jones, a film produced by Hallmark Entertainment.Queen LatifahIn 2008, Latifah appeared in the crime comedy Mad Money opposite Academy Award - winner Diane Keaton as well as Katie Holmes and Ted Danson.Edward NortonIn 2013, Norton starred in The Lonely Island's music video, Spring Break Anthem, alongside Andy Samberg, Zach Galifinakis, James Franco, Akiva Schaffer and Jorma Taccone.Ned BeattyIn 1981, Beatty appeared in the comedy/science fiction film The Incredible Shrinking Woman, directed by Joel Schumacher and starring by Lily Tomlin.Lorelei Lee (pornographic actress)In May 2011, Variety announced the production of About Cherry, an independent movie written by Lee alongside Stephen Elliott, directed by the same Elliott and starring James Franco, Heather Graham and Lili Taylor.Tony GilroyGilroy also wrote and directed his next film, Duplicity, released March 20, 2009, and starring Clive Owen, Julia Roberts and Tom Wilkinson.Sarah PaulsonIn 2005 she starred as Laura Wingfield in a revival of Tennessee Williams' play The Glass Menagerie alongside Jessica Lange, Josh Lucas, and Christian Slater.Rue McClanahanIn 2003, she appeared in the musical romantic comedy film The Fighting Temptations as Nancy Stringer, which costarred Cuba Gooding, Jr., BeyoncÃ© Knowles, Mike Epps and Steve Harvey.John Enos IIIHe was next cast in `` Missionary Man'' (2007), an action thriller directed, co-written by and starring Dolph Lundgren.Kate NashNash had a small role in Greetings from Tim Buckley, a film on Tim and Jeff Buckley, which premiered at the 2012 Toronto International Film Festival.Jet LiIn 2003 he reunited with producer Joel Silver for the action thriller film Cradle 2 The Grave where he starred alongside rapper DMX and fellow martial artist Mark Dacascos.Charles MessinaIn May 2010, Messina directed and co-wrote (along with Vincent Gogliormella) the script Twas The Night Before a Brooklyn Christmas, starring Mario Cantone, Michael Rispoli and Robert Cuccioli, also at 45 Bleecker Street.Ryan Murphy (writer)On January 20, 2012, it was announced that the next film Murphy would be directing is a screen adaptation by Larry Kramer of his Broadway play The Normal Heart, starring Mark Ruffalo, Roberts, Baldwin, Matt Bomer and Jim Parsons.Jenna FischerFischer was named as producer of the mid-August through October 2010 run of the critically acclaimed play Sad Happy Sucker, written by her husband Lee Kirk and directed by friend Sean Gunn.Vincent PastoreIn 2007, he starred in the independent feature film P. J. : A Journey of the Heart, co-starring with Sopranos co-star John Heard and Robert Picardo.Bruce PayneIn 1986 both Payne and Berkoff appeared in Julien Temple's musical Absolute Beginners along with David Bowie, Eddie O'Connell, James Fox, Lionel Blair and Edward Tudor-Pole.Martina GedeckIn 2006 Gedeck appeared in five major films : The Elementary Particles (2006) as Christiane, The Lives of Others (2006) as Christa-Maria Sieland, The Perfect Friend (2006) as MarlÃ¨ne, Summer'04 (2006) as Miriam Franz, and Robert De Niro's The Good Shepherd (2006) as Hanna Schiller, starring opposite Matt Damon and John Turturro.Bobbie CrynerBobbie Cryner appeared briefly in the 1995 film Something to Talk About starring Julia Roberts, Dennis Quaid, and Robert Duvall.Rollin JarrettHis original screenplay Laws of Deception was made into a film in 1997 and starred C. Thomas Howell, James Russo and Brian Austin Green and was directed by Joey Travolta, brother of John Travolta.Columbus ShortIn 2007, Columbus appeared in the movie This Christmas also starring Chris Brown and Lauren London.Allison BurnettIn 2008, Allison wrote, with Robert Fyvolent and Mark Brinker, the crime thriller Untraceable (2008) starring Diane Lane.Selena GomezGomez also appeared in the thriller Getaway, with Ethan Hawke and Jon Voight, which was released on August 30, 2013 in the United States.Mena SuvariSuvari starred alongside her American Pie co-star Jason Biggs in the romantic comedy Loser (2000).Mary NighyShe has directed short film s including Lulu and Player, the latter was written by Sam Hodges, starred Pete Postlethwaite, Celia Imrie, Haydn Gwynne and Sam Hodges and premiered at the 2008 Miami Short Film Festival.Saul RubinekRubinek played Alan Mintz opposite Nicolas Cage in the 2000 film The Family Man.Hayden PanettiereIn 2004, she appeared in the Disney Channel film Tiger Cruise, and in Raising Helen as Kate Hudson's adolescent niece.Peter MooneyIn 2009, Mooney starred in the Canadian independent thriller Summer's Moon as Tom Hoxey, alongside Twilight actress Ashley Greene, who portrays Summer.Daryl HaneyBack in the U. S., Haney appeared as a drug dealer in Jennifer Lynch's'' Surveillance'' (2008), which stars Bill Pullman and Julia Ormond.Harry SinclairHis third feature was Toy Love (2002) starring Dean O'Gorman and Kate Elliott.Gerard ButlerIn 2009, he starred in the Mark Neveldine/Brian Taylor film Gamer, The Ugly Truth and Law Abiding Citizen, which he also co-produced.Miles TellerIn 2013, he starred in 21 & Over, written and directed by Jon Lucas and Scott Moore.Eddi ReaderIn 2009, she performed in period-drama Me and Orson Welles, directed by Richard Linklater and starring Zac Efron, Christian McKay and Claire Danes.Tom SaviniIn the 2008 novel Bad Moon Rising by Jonathan Maberry, Savini appears as one of the real-world horror celebrities who are in the fictional town of Pine Deep when monsters attack ; other celebrities include James Gunn, Jim O'Rear, Brinke Stevens, Ken Foree, Stephen Susco, Debbie Rochon, Joe Bob Briggs and blues man Mem Shannon.Lonnie ColemanHis lone screenplay was for the 1958 film Hot Spell (film) which starred Shirley Booth and Anthony Quinn.Rene LavanHe also appeared in Christmas with the Kranks (2004) alongside Tim Allen and Jamie Lee Curtis.Kevin LightHe won a gold medal at the 2008 Summer Olympics in the men's eights with Andrew Byrnes, Kyle Hamilton, Malcolm Howard, Adam Kreek, Ben Rutledge, Dominic Sieterle, Jake Wetzel and cox Brian Price.Nathan FillionFillion starred in the romantic comedy film Waitress, written and directed by Adrienne Shelly, which premiered at the Sundance Film Festival on January 21, 2007, and opened in theaters on May 2, 2007.Casey Donovan (actor)Culver first appeared as Casey Donovan in Boys in the Sand, directed by Wakefield Poole, in 1971.Casey AffleckHe starred opposite Rooney Mara in the independent modern-day Bonnie and Clyde film Ai n't Them Bodies Saints, released in 2013.Joan JettThe film explores the friendship between Jett and Runaways' lead singer, Cherie Currie, played by Dakota Fanning, and premiered at the 2010 Sundance Film Festival on Jan 24, 2010.Rooney MaraShe starred in David Lowery's 2013 independent film Ai n't Them Bodies Saints which is described as a modern-day Bonnie and Clyde story, alongside Casey Affleck and Ben Foster.Assi DayanIn 1969 Dayan co-starred in the American movie A Walk with Love and Death, set in medieval France and directed by John Huston, in which he plays alongside Huston's daughter, Angelica.Henry NormalHe co-wrote The Royle Family with Caroline Aherne and Craig Cash, and was co-screenwriter for the 2001 film The Parole Officer, starring Steve Coogan.Rachael Leigh CookShe starred in the independent film Broken Kingdom, which was directed by her husband Daniel Gillie s and premier on October 2, 2012.Derek Bentley caseThe 1991 movie Let Him Have It, starring Christopher Eccleston as Bentley and Paul Reynolds as Craig, relates the story, as do the songs'' Derek Bentley'' by Ewan MacColl and Peggy Seeger,'' Let Him Dangle'' by Elvis Costello,'' Let Him Have It'' by The Bureau, and'' Bentley and Craig'' by Ralph McTell, whose mother was a friend of the Bentley family.Anna FrielIn November 2010, Friel starred in London Boulevard alongside Ray Winstone, Colin Farrell, Keira Knightley and her then partner David Thewlis.Abel FerraraAfter recording two commentaries for Driller Killer and King of New York, he made Mary (2005), the religious-themed film starring Forrest Whitaker, Marion Cotillard, Juliette Binoche, Heather Graham, Stefania Rocca and Matthew Modine.Clint EastwoodIn 1997, Eastwood directed and starred in the political thriller Absolute Power, alongside Gene Hackman (with whom he had appeared in Unforgiven).John KrasinskiFrom April to June 2008 he filmed Away We Go, directed by Sam Mendes and co-starring Maya Rudolph.Kayla EwellEwell starred opposite Austin Stowell and Danny Glover in the 2013 Hallmark Movie Channel film, Shuffelton's Barbershop, as Norma, a country music singer and songwriter.Jamie BellIn 2005, he starred opposite Evan Rachel Wood in the Green Day video Wake Me Up When September Ends, directed by Samuel Bayer.Lachy HulmeIn 2012, Hulme also appeared in the comedy film Scumbus, written & produced by, and starring, Ed Kavalee, the film airing on Ch-10 in November.Kathy NajimyIn 2001, she co-starred in the hit comedy film Rat Race alongside John Cleese, Rowan Atkinson, Cuba Gooding, Jr., Whoopi Goldberg, Jon Lovitz and Seth Green.Will FerrellIn 2010, he was the executive producer and star of The Other Guys, a buddy cop film, which also has an ensemble cast which consists of Mark Wahlberg, Eva Mendes, Michael Keaton, Steve Coogan, Ray Stevenson, Samuel L. Jackson and Dwayne Johnson.Anna PaquinIn 2010, Paquin's film The Romantics, a romantic comedy with Josh Duhamel and Katie Holmes, was released in the US at selected cinemas in September.Kate HardieIn 2011 she wrote and directed a short film called Shoot Me starring Claire Skinner and Paul Andrew Williams and produced by Rankin.Bruce PayneIn 1994 Payne appeared as a'' disgruntled man'' named Edward De Lapoer in H. P. Lovecraft's : Necronomicon which also featured fellow British thespian David Warner.Steve SchirripaIn the Fall, 2010, Schirripa had a guest star role in the digital comedy short film,'' Lil DPC,'' from writer/director Michael Ratner, which also features Rapper Fat Joe and Blink 182's Mark Hoppus.Norah JonesJones made her film debut in 2007 in the romance / drama film My Blueberry Nights, directed by Wong Kar Wai, co-starring Jude Law, David Strathairn, Rachel Weisz and Natalie Portman.Dudley MooreIn 1984, Moore had another hit, starring in the Blake Edwards directed Micki + Maude, co-starring Amy Irving.Marley SheltonIn 2001, Shelton appeared in the horror film Valentine, alongside Denise Richards and David Boreanaz.Reece ShearsmithIn 2012 he starred in Bad Sugar, a comedy series written by Sam Bain & Jesse Armstrong, along with Olivia Colman and Julia Davis.Don LeIn mid 2011, Le produced a series of 3 short comedic sketches with the world-renowned Wong Fu Productions starring Harry Shum Jr., Tyler Shields, famed photographer, co-starred as a Mugger in one of the spots.Aaron EckhartHe recently appeared as the U. S. President who has taken hostage in the 2013 action thriller Olympus Has Fallen.Ned BeattyIn the middle of 1980s, Beatty appeared in the comedy film Restless Natives (1985), directed by Michael Hoffman and starring Vincent Friell.Ed Wood In 1954, Wood directed and produced a crime film, Jail Bait (originally titled The Hidden Face), along with co-writer Alex Gordon, which starred Lyle Talbot and Steve Reeves.Keira Knightley Knightley's only film of 2011 was David Cronenberg's historical drama A Dangerous Method, co-starring Viggo Mortensen, Michael Fassbender and Vincent Cassel.Oscar IsaacIn 2013, Isaac starred in the film Inside Llewyn Davis, written and directed by the Coen Brothers.Emma StoneIn 2007, Stone made her feature film debut, co-starring in the comedy Superbad opposite Michael Cera and Jonah Hill and directed by Greg Mottola.Frances RaffertyFor instance, in 1948, she starred with Hugh Beaumont in the Film Noir movie, Money Madness, directed by Sam Newfield.Latif Yahia The movie The Devil's Double, directed by Lee Tamahori and starring Dominic Cooper as Yahia, premiered at the 2011 Sundance Film Festival on January 22, 2011.George SluppickIn 2008, working alongside Bomar, George and Al Gamble played on the score for the film, Gospel Hill, which stars Angela Bassett, Giancarlo Esposito, Danny Glover, Julia Stiles and Samuel L. Jackson.Wes BentleyIn 2012, Bentley also starred with Amber Tamblyn and Vincent Piazza in the indie feature 3 Nights in the Desert directed by Gabriel Cowan written by award winning playwright Adam Chanzit and produced by John Suits.Larry ClarkIn 1993, Clark directed Chris Isaak's music video'' Solitary Man''.Jim CarreyHe most recently starred alongside former co-star Steve Carell in the Don Scardino - directed comedy film Burt Wonderstone (2013).KaDee StricklandStrickland, whose co-stars in the pilot included Frances Fisher and Bruce McGill, said she was'' really excited to have the opportunity to portray this phenomenal lady'', Strickland was also cast in the independently financed 1950s-set film Walker Payne as laid-off stripminer Jason Patric's love interest ; in a review of the film at the 2006 Tribeca Film Festival, Variety wrote that Strickland was'' elegant''.Ben BrowderHe appeared in the 2004 movie A Killer Within, co-starring C. Thomas Howell and Sean Young.Chris CroucherIn 2011 Chris wrote and produced the short film Friend Request Pending -- a comedy drama about Social Networking starring Judi Dench, Penny Ryder, Philip Jackson, John Macmillan and Tom Hiddleston.Cindy ValentineThe Gentleman (2007) : Directed by Joe Valenti, starring Jon Doscher, Rachael Robbins and Monica Leigh, Valentine was cast as Stacy.Dianna AgronIn 2013, Agron co-starred as Belle Blake, alongside Robert De Niro, Michelle Pfeiffer, and Tommy Lee Jones in the action crime-comedy film The Family.Val KilmerIn 1983 he appeared Off Broadway in'' The Slab Boys'' with Kevin Bacon and Sean Penn.Simon StoneIn 2009 he directed Aleksei Arbuzov's The Promise for Belvoir, starring Ewen Leslie, Alison Bell and Chris Ryan.Liam AikenIn March 2009, Aiken was cast as Johnnie Pappas in Michael Winterbottom's remake of The Killer Inside Me, starring Casey Affleck, Jessica Alba and Kate Hudson.William H. MacyDirty Girl, which starred Macy along with Juno Temple, Milla Jovovich, Mary Steenburgen and Tim McGraw, premiered September 12, 2010 at the Toronto International Film Festival.Kristen WiigIn 2011, she starred in the film Bridesmaids, which she co-wrote with fellow Groundlings performer Annie Mumolo for Universal Pictures, released on May 13, 2011.Wendi McLendon-CoveyMcLendon-Covey appeared in the 2012 ensemble cast romantic comedy What to Expect When You're Expecting, directed by Kirk Jones, as well had cameo in Steven Soderbergh's movie Magic Mike.Bruce PayneIn 2008, Payne appeared alongside Serena Scott Thomas, Grace Zabriskie and Brett Cullen in the psychological drama Brothel, which was directed by Amy Waddell.Pierce Gagnon In January 2011, he was cast in the film Looper starring Bruce Willis, Joseph Gordon-Levitt, and Emily Blunt.Fabian ForteThe 1980 film The Idolmaker, written by Edward Di Lorenzo and directed by Taylor Hackford, was a thinly-disguised biography of Fabian (called'' Caesare'' in the film), as well as songwriter/producer Marcucci (called'' Vinnie Vacarri'') and Frankie Avalon (called'' Tommy Dee'').Romola GaraiAlso in 2006, she starred in the biographical drama movie Amazing Grace, which was directed by Michael Apted and co-starring Ioan Gruffudd, Benedict Cumberbatch, and Michael Gambon.Bruce PayneIn 2013, Payne appeared alongside Ethan Hawke, Selena Gomez, Jon Voight, Paul Freeman, and Rebecca Budig in the Warner Bros. action film Getaway, which was directed by Courtney Solomon.Jon SedaHe appeared in the 2011 film Larry Crowne, which starred, and was co-written and directed by, Tom Hanks.Don McKellarHe also appeared alongside Jude Law and Jennifer Jason Leigh in David Cronenberg's 1999 film eXistenZ.
